page.text: The pump appears to be working perfectly. Humming, clicking and chugging to spurt gouts of water up out the spout to fill up the bucket. You probably shouldn't ruin a good thing.
The pump should be fixed, you should tell Nissa about it and see if it'll work now.
The pump is broken and in need of repair. The mechanisms appear to have nothing significantly wrong with them though, it might be something else that's stopping it working.

choice.text: I have no idea what i'm doing here.

page.text: The generator's electrical components and wiring seem to have been worn out and damaged. you'd need some scraps to even attempt a repair and replace the broken pieces and degraded wiring.

choice.text: I have two scrap, i'll try and fix the pump's motor.
I don't have anything to use as parts right now.
I think i'll leave it be for now.

page.text: You skillfully fashion a series of replacement parts from the fragments of wiring, metal and electronic components you have on hand and place them into the engine. Sealing it up again you're confident the device will function now, you should probably tell Nissa so you can both try it together.

You attempt to replace the damaged components, but your crude fumbling and incompetent bungling only succeed in ruining perfectly good wires and mangling metal fragments beyond any reasonable use. You're fairly sure you've not repaired the engine, and that you've wasted the materials used in the attempt. Nothing but the risk of further damage to your own pride stops you making the attempt again though if you had more materials.

choice.text: darn, well maybe i can try again

page.text: The pump appears to be inactive. But it's no business of yours and you are a guest in the saurian village.
